messages.message:
Hello, please let me know if there is a better place to post this. I need to export a list of logins from an instance of Instabase (23.07.8). When I go to Audit Logs, select the Log type and export to CSV, the headers show as "0,1,2,3,4" and the timestamp is not in a format that can be converted to a date in Excel. My specific use case is:
• Find users (based on their email domain) who haven't logged in since XXXX date. As I can't filter by a specific domain in the Audit Log, I need to export to Excel/Sheets to filters rows by the email domain, but then I can't read the date.

even though the headers are “0,1,2,3,4”, they directly correspond to the headers you saw in the Audit Logs UI

so you can rename the header row in Excel, based on what you see in the Audit Logs UI

the timestamp represents the milliseconds elapsed since 1/1/1970

this thread describes several ways in Excel to convert this timestamp into a date https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16070868/converting-time-stamps-in-excel-to-dates

Thank you Serena for sharing this. I'm very adept at Excel and understand how to use formulas and formatting. The directions on Stack Overflow do not result in a readable date format either in Excel. I figured it out on my own, but only after spending more time researching. Seems like this is harder than it needs to be for all of us, but especially for our customers. Is there a way to make this more intuitive and easier for customers (the date formatting and the column names)?

glad to hear that you figured it out! it seems this is our latest process for submitting feature requests https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TPM/pages/2084372515/Customer+and+Field+Feedback#Creating-the-Request-Directly-in-Jira
Perfect. Thank you @Serena! I'll submit a request.
